commit_message:
Change passing session to context for TypeDriver

We have a number of functions that expect to get session as one
of the arguments. Passing session is not correct and this prevents
of using new enginefacade which expects context to be passed and
session will be injected in current context.

NeutronLibImpact

Partially-Implements blueprint: enginefacade-switch

Change-Id: I68ac442f11a6698bc43210fae877ba3809b1c02d

commit_message:
GPFS KNFS: Do not reuse ssh prefix in loop

Fix GPFS KNFS allow/deny access so that it does not reuse
the ssh prefix when looping through NFS server commands for
allow and deny access.

This fixes GPFS KNFS allow/deny access incorrect behavior
when multiple NFS servers are configured (gpfs_nfs_server_list)
and any of the servers are remote (except the last one).

Change-Id: I8c182eed386e8325b087c3192d363502bb848633
Closes-Bug: #1651578

commit_message:
[ops-guide] Adding new content to guide

This patch is to simply create the ToC in the draft folder and to
add pre-existing content. Edits will come later. Please review
based on structure only.

subject: Make body of std.email optional
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-21 07:48:05.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/actions/std_actions.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/mistral/commit/4cea9bd18bb04d8663ccf1ea64c71e8d7682f462', 'message': 'Make body of std.email optional

According to SMTP protocol both the subject and body of the email
can be blank. Hence, making the body of std.email as optional.

commit_message:
Make body of std.email optional

According to SMTP protocol both the subject and body of the email
can be blank. Hence, making the body of std.email as optional.

Change-Id: I1a2551467247a46c4e3fa5425a367d0f83756b9c
Closes-Bug: #1649366

added_lines: self.body = body or "<No body>"

commit_message:
Disable invalid API test till it's fixed

* The problem of this test is that it tries to use engine, but
  engine doesn't even start in API tests, that's why we get
  messaging timeout and HTTP 500 error

Change-Id: I46ad5bc593391efd6be8837cf65e66cb257add7d

commit_message:
Add __ne__ built-in function

In Python 3 __ne__ by default delegates to __eq__ and inverts the
result, but in Python 2 they urge you to define __ne__ when you define
__eq__ for it to work properly [1]. There are no implied relationships
among the comparison operators. The truth of x==y does not imply that
x!=y is false. Accordingly, when defining __eq__(), one should also
define __ne__() so that the operators will behave as expected.

[1]https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#object.__ne__

Change-Id: I6325e50bfd2b45449874607a09a43c225ebae01f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/17/413917/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __ne__(self, other): return not self.__eq__(other)

commit_message:
Performance monitoring spec

Change-Id: I9d70a030d90fef02e35229cc3afe5d71914de08a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-specs refs/changes/24/410924/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Enable deployment of performace monitoring ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tripleo/+spec/tripleo-opstools-performance-monitoring TripleO should have a possibility to automatically setup and install the performance monitoring agent (collectd) to service the overcloud. Problem Description =================== We need to easily enable operators to connect overcloud nodes to performance monitoring stack. The possible way to do so is to install collectd agent together with set of plugins, depending on a metrics we want to collect from overcloud nodes. Summary of use cases: 1. collectd deployed on each overcloud node reporting configured metrics (via collectd plugins) to external collector. Proposed Change =============== Overview -------- The collectd service will be deployed as a composable service on the overcloud stack when it is explicitly stated via environment file. Security Impact --------------- None Other End User Impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ Metric collection and transport to the monitoring node can create I/O which might have performance impact on monitored nodes. Other Deployer Impact --------------------- New parameters will be added to tripleo-heat-templates: # TBD Developer Impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Lars Kellogg-Stedman (larsks) Other contributors: Martin Magr (mmagr) Work Items ---------- * puppet-tripleo profile for collectd service * tripleo-heat-templates composable service for collectd deployment Dependencies ============ * Puppet module for collectd service: puppet-collectd [1] * CentOS Opstools SIG repo [2] Testing ======= We should consider creating CI job for deploying overcloud with monitoring node to perform functional testing. Documentation Impact ==================== New template parameters will have to be documented. References ========== [1] https://github.com/voxpupuli/puppet-collectd [2] https://wiki.centos.org/SpecialInterestGroup/OpsTools

* Change swift rsync group

Change-Id: I57b4dbaf9838c15612d60846ae27b0fdd01409cc

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/01/411301/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: if roles_include(['controller', 'primary-controller']) { $storage_hash = hiera_hash('storage', {}) if (!$storage_hash['images_ceph'] and !$storage_hash['objects_ceph'] and !$storage_hash['images_vcenter']) { # Glance package update changes permissions for /var/lib/glance and makes # it and its subdirectories owned by glance:glance (it executes in postinst stage). # We use /var/lib/glance/node as swift storage, and we need to allow # swift user to write into this directory. We should update all subdirectories # in /var/lib/glance/node to be owned by swift:swift. This should be applied right # after glance package update to decrease swift service downtime to minimum. # Swift services restart isn't required. $swift_partition = hiera('swift_partition', '/var/lib/glance/node') if $swift_partition =~ /\/var\/lib\/glance\// { # We can't use 'file' resource because we need to be sure that swift user and # group exist. They could be absent in case of adding new controller node # for already upgraded environment. exec { '/var/lib/glance/': command => 'chgrp swift /var/lib/glance/', onlyif => 'getent group swift && test -d /var/lib/glance/', path => ['/bin/', '/usr/bin/'], logoutput => 'on_failure', } -> exec { $swift_partition: command => "chown -R swift:swift ${swift_partition}", onlyif => "getent passwd swift && test -d ${swift_partition}", path => ['/bin/', '/usr/bin/'], logoutput => 'on_failure', } } } }

commit_message:
grafana: Remove unused trusty jobs from Neutron dashboard

ubuntu-trusty jobs don't run on master branch and grafana either doesn't
show the trend or the line is at 0.

commit_message:
Enable filtering for Cinder LVM volumes

Currently the default behavior of LVM is
to scan all available block devices in
/dev folder, this leads to issues on environments
with Cinder LVM volumes. Guest's volumes are recognized
by parent host's OS and are scanned by LVM. If guest's
volume contains LVM inside, it is also detected by
parent host's OS. Such volumes can not be
deleted.

This patch modifies LVM filter on Cinder node in
order to exclude LVs present in Cinder volume group
from LVM scan. During testing it was found that
initramds should be updated upon changing of
filtering rules.

Closes-Bug: #1645624

Change-Id: I49e286e92095259e0196b6dd49dc10da0ebb4c20
(cherry picked from commit 63cf53e96a49661f5f045a592782efb153f83d54)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/59/411759/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $cinder_lvm_filter = "\"r|^/dev/${volume_group}/.*|\"" augeas { 'lvm-conf-set-cinder-filter': context => '/files/etc/lvm/lvm.conf/devices/dict/', changes => "set global_filter/list/1/str ${cinder_lvm_filter}", tag => 'lvm-conf-augeas' } exec { 'Update initramfs': command => 'update-initramfs -u -k all', path => '/usr/bin:/bin:/usr/sbin:/sbin' } Augeas<| tag == 'lvm-conf-augeas'|> ~> Exec<| title == 'Update initramfs' |>

commit_message:
Change CLI command to get release version

So the Newton not supported old format like "fuel --fuel-version"
Current format is "fuel2 fuel-version".
Used for reboot_plugin tests

Change-Id: I9ee6602ed435d6e87cc657d10e7c2424b84cde4a
Closes-Bug: 1631900

commit_message:
Enable filtering for Cinder LVM volumes

Currently the default behavior of LVM is
to scan all available block devices in
/dev folder, this leads to issues on environments
with Cinder LVM volumes. Guest's volumes are recognized
by parent host's OS and are scanned by LVM. If guest's
volume contains LVM inside, it is also detected by
parent host's OS. Such volumes can not be
deleted.

This patch modifies LVM filter on Cinder node in
order to exclude LVs present in Cinder volume group
from LVM scan. During testing it was found that
initramds should be updated upon changing of
filtering rules.

Closes-Bug: #1645624

Change-Id: I49e286e92095259e0196b6dd49dc10da0ebb4c20
(cherry picked from commit 63cf53e96a49661f5f045a592782efb153f83d54)

commit_message:
Fix dependency issues between tasks

DB tasks should wait for galera explicitly. There shouldn't be
conditions when primary-database is done, allowing *-db tasks to create
users while galera is syncing with other nodes. That causes split brain
as *-db tasks create users in MyISAM tables which is not handled by
Galera.

Closes-Bug: #1636841
Change-Id: I729ba0f2bfce1e731de36c932f5f0350e91adb22
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit 139c5f4fadd45c3d1430c38b6a3c7238612d4211)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/07/413107/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Fix version response from root controller
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-19 10:22:47.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/api/controllers/root.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/api/v2/test_root.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/mistral/commit/4293e4061fdfb3582de225f9e15e4cf7616df4c7', 'message': "Fix version response from root controller

According to guideline from API-WG [1], the version discovery protocol
requires a GET on '/' return a dictionary containing 'versions', whose
value is a list of supported versions. Under each version record, there
could be multiple 'links'. This patch tunes the root controller to
better align with this guideline.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/api-wg/tree/guidelines/
microversion_specification.rst#n130

Change-Id: I6834310e6d4e7e14a7720f6577890757fe4dca21

commit_message:
Fix version response from root controller

According to guideline from API-WG [1], the version discovery protocol
requires a GET on '/' return a dictionary containing 'versions', whose
value is a list of supported versions. Under each version record, there
could be multiple 'links'. This patch tunes the root controller to
better align with this guideline.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/api-wg/tree/guidelines/
microversion_specification.rst#n130

Change-Id: I6834310e6d4e7e14a7720f6577890757fe4dca21

commit_message:
Placement service only using default HTTPd ports

The placement API configuration was binding a specific port *and* was supporting
to be called by the default HTTPd ports using a Location directive.

Given that the corresponding service catalog entry for the placement service type
doesn't mention the specific application port but is rather using the default
port 80, we can remove that specific port and just use the default config.

Note that we still need to use a VirtualHost directive for the specific placement
config because ErrorLog is only scoped for either server or virtualhost but can't
be set for a Location (or a Directory) context.

Change-Id: I9a26dcff4b879cf9e82e43a3d1aca2e4fe6aa3e6

commit_message:
Fix: 'memcached_servers' is miswrited to 'memcache_servers'

Using 'memcached' instead of {{ memcached_servers }}. cause, 'memcached' is a fix service name in kolla-kubernetes, and glance-api, rabbitmq, mariadb are also used with fix value.

Modify 'memcache_servers' to 'memcached_servers', cause, it was miswrited.

Change-Id: Iea360999119b55d4c496c7e4f6f70702633170b9
Closes-Bug: #1638784
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/88/393088/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

added_lines: Vitrage Evaluator serves as workflow manager controlling the analysis and activation of templates and execution of template actions. Template Validator ensures that a new template is correct. Meaning, it conforms with Vitrage Template Standard.Templates do not always meet the Vitrage Template Standard. For example, unsupported action, invalid alarm name, incorrect graph template and etc.Template validator is a part of Vitrage Evaluator. It receives a template, runs over it and checks its correctness. If the template is valid, it notify the Evaluator Engine which inserts the template into the template DB. Otherwise, insertion is failed.

subject: Use subqueries for rbac_entries and subnets<->network
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-12 19:47:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/91f2381653107e8b44b84426f5cc5765d4846513', 'message': "Use subqueries for rbac_entries and subnets<->network

Loading subnets as part of the networks list and networks
as part of the subnets list appears to have a significant
impact when the network has tags and the subnets have
extra routes entries. This is even further compounded by
the network having rbac entries (likely due to the subnet
inheriting the RBAC entries of the network with the custom
join condition in the model).

This patch converts rbac_entries on both subnet and network
to use a subquery and converts the network and subnets
relationships on the subnet and network models (respectively)
to use subqueries as well.

On my dev environment after running the script in the report,
a network list took 5 minutes. Converting just the rbac_entries
or just the network/subnet relationship to subqueries reduced it
to 3-5 seconds. Converting both (as this patch does), reduces it
back down to a couple of hundred milliseconds (normal perf of my
development env with the current network count).

Subqueries will just cost us a constant number of queries and
won't scale up with result count so this should not impact scalability
in any way.

None of these fields are queryable from the API, so we don't need
to worry about breaking queries against the models.

Change-Id: Ic1947e3d78d58a79b21344b10cb7ab0e573e419f
Closes-Bug: #1649317
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-12 22:46:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/b914e712e8cc2c6c7486ff7ab098912b194352fd', 'message': "Use subqueries for rbac_entries and subnets<->network

commit_message:
Use subqueries for rbac_entries and subnets<->network

Loading subnets as part of the networks list and networks
as part of the subnets list appears to have a significant
impact when the network has tags and the subnets have
extra routes entries. This is even further compounded by
the network having rbac entries (likely due to the subnet
inheriting the RBAC entries of the network with the custom
join condition in the model).

This patch converts rbac_entries on both subnet and network
to use a subquery and converts the network and subnets
relationships on the subnet and network models (respectively)
to use subqueries as well.

On my dev environment after running the script in the report,
a network list took 5 minutes. Converting just the rbac_entries
or just the network/subnet relationship to subqueries reduced it
to 3-5 seconds. Converting both (as this patch does), reduces it
back down to a couple of hundred milliseconds (normal perf of my
development env with the current network count).

Subqueries will just cost us a constant number of queries and
won't scale up with result count so this should not impact scalability
in any way.

None of these fields are queryable from the API, so we don't need
to worry about breaking queries against the models.

Partial-Bug: #1649317
Change-Id: Ic1947e3d78d58a79b21344b10cb7ab0e573e419f

deleted_lines: rbac_db_models.NetworkRBAC, lazy='joined', uselist=True, Subnet, backref=orm.backref('networks', lazy='joined'), lazy="joined") backref='network', lazy='joined',

commit_message:
Add memcached_servers for keystone authtoken

This change allows a user to manage the memcached servers for
keystone_authtoken.

Change-Id: Ic3963631caab327c1f44819be9eb14d0173085a2

If left # undefined, tokens will instead be cached in-process. # Defaults to $::os_service_default. # $memcached_servers = $::os_service_default, 'keystone_authtoken/memcached_servers': value => join(any2array($memcached_servers), ',');

Sahara::ImageRegistry observe reality implement

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/48/274648/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from heat.common import exception def get_live_state(self, resource_properties): image_reality = {} try: image_data = self._show_resource() except Exception as ex: if self.client_plugin().is_not_found(ex): raise exception.EntityNotFound(entity='Resource', name=self.name) raise old_id = self.client_plugin('glance').find_image_by_name_or_id( resource_properties.get(self.IMAGE)) new_id = self.client_plugin('glance').find_image_by_name_or_id( image_data.get('id')) if old_id or new_id != old_id: image_reality.update({self.IMAGE: image_data.get('id')}) else: image_reality.update( {self.IMAGE: resource_properties.get(self.IMAGE)}) props_keys = [self.USERNAME, self.DESCRIPTION, self.TAGS] for key in props_keys: image_reality.update({key: image_data.get(key)}) return image_reality

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-22 07:20:06.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lbaas/services/loadbalancer/data_models.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas/commit/d67ecf2e1106f2c844b8e32b6a97721c5df71c56', 'message': 'Replace method vars().get to getattr

Vars().get and getattr both can get the attribute of an object.
But getattr runs faster than vars().get.
The following is the output of test:
[root@yindesheng neutron-lbaas]# python -m timeit  -n 100000 'import os; vars(os).get("fork")'

Change-Id: I0f52ec2ad06e8add6701cd4ec83ba016f5b49634
'}]
commit_message:
Replace method vars().get to getattr

Vars().get and getattr both can get the attribute of an object.
But getattr runs faster than vars().get.
The following is the output of test:
[root@yindesheng neutron-lbaas]# python -m timeit  -n 100000 'import os; vars(os).get("fork")'
100000 loops, best of 3: 1.1 usec per loop
[root@yindesheng neutron-lbaas]# python -m timeit  -n 100000 'import os; vars(os).get("fork")'
100000 loops, best of 3: 1.13 usec per loop
[root@yindesheng neutron-lbaas]# python -m timeit  -n 100000 'import os; getattr(os, "fork")'
100000 loops, best of 3: 0.821 usec per loop
[root@yindesheng neutron-lbaas]# python -m timeit  -n 100000 'import os; getattr(os, "fork")'
100000 loops, best of 3: 0.794 usec per loop

Change-Id: I0f52ec2ad06e8add6701cd4ec83ba016f5b49634
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas refs/changes/41/413941/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: If2fc49e31782a32ab0219a830351c7d4b90a89e1

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Iff88f55dc51981ce502d7d3e67c467242980f20c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/45/411845/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ENVIRONMENT_DB_DICT = {k: v for k, v in ENVIRONMENT_DB.items()}
deleted_lines: ENVIRONMENT_DB_DICT = {k: v for k, v in six.iteritems(ENVIRONMENT_DB)}

commit_message:
Fix tempest tests

* sending 'None' as a request body implies header
'Content-Length: 0', but the test was expecting
no header.
* invalid parameters were passed to call_until_true

Depends-On: Icce74fd6d7e674f408277e328468bedbc3d0aa6b
Change-Id: Ia4fc7cdec0a38d0b46aadfedd6cc9919edaa1963
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-log-api refs/changes/44/409144/24 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if payload_size <= 0: raise falcon.HTTPLengthRequired( title='Content length header is invalid', description='Content length must be greater than 0' )

commit_message:
Changed the RPC API from "call" to "cast" for run

Zun run failing while pulling a large image so
RPC API of "container_run" changed from "call" to
"cast" in zun/compute/api.py as discussed in meeting.

Closes-bug: #1650979

Change-Id: I4934adbf0c5557e8465087e058b31c762d1272a7

commit_message:
Do not use hardcoded controller_node_names when setting up the cluster

Currently we chose the pacemaker cluster node by simply taking
hiera('controller_node_names'). We should instead use the
pacemaker_short_node_names array which is built dynamically
from all the nodes that include the pacemaker service.

Change-Id: I0a3e4acaab11e078da5eeb2ef2adde5387785927
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/20/408220/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $pacemaker_short_node_names = join(hiera('pacemaker_short_node_names'), ",") $pacemaker_cluster_members = downcase(regsubst($pacemaker_short_node_names), ',', ' ', 'G')

commit_message:
formalizing configure_nova_kvm

The earlier hack has proved to be quite good, and has not produced
many problems. Messages echoed to the summary log are not stashed in
logstash, moving to a single message in the log instead. Changed the
function name to a more formal name (configure_nova_kvm) instead of
tweak_nova.

Change-Id: I85364c6530058e964a8eba7fb515d7deadfd5d72
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/66/413166/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # configure_nova_kvm() - update the nova hypervisor configuration if possible function configure_nova_kvm { cpu="unknown" cpu="Intel" cpu="AMD" virt_type=$(iniget $NOVA_CONF libvirt virt_type) echo "configure_nova_kvm: using virt_type: ${virt_type} for cpu: ${cpu}." configure_nova_kvm
deleted_lines: # tweak_nova() - update the nova hypervisor configuration if possible function tweak_nova { else echo_summary "Found Intel with no support for nested KVM." else echo_summary "Found AMD with no support for nested KVM." echo_summary "Configuring Nova to use KVM." else virt_type=$(iniget $NOVA_CONF libvirt virt_type) echo_summary "Nested hypervisor not supported, using ${virt_type}." else virt_type=$(iniget $NOVA_CONF libvirt virt_type) echo_summary "Unable to configure Nova to use KVM, using ${virt_type}." echo "Unable to configure Nova to use KVM, using ${virt_type}." tweak_nova

commit_message:
Sort and Remove duplicate field types

The FIELD_TYPE_VALUE_GENERATOR_MAP dictionary contains several
duplicated keys that override the function that generates random
values. This change cleans up the current values.

Change-Id: I230fdefe91c08a32bd783c5e5f7fcae776c9f979
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

commit_message:
Start logging Python 3 team channel

After a recent discussion in #openstack-python3 we've decided we should
start logging the channel. It's already co-owned by openstackinfra so
this should be all that's necessary to add logging to the channel.

Change-Id: Ia3fa116c610a9a259618f1500558f13494422557

subject: make release script repo cloning function more resilient
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-21 20:17:03.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/release-tools/update_constraints.sh', 'jenkins/scripts/common.sh', 'jenkins/scripts/release-tools/functions', 'jenkins/jobs/release-jobs.yaml', 'jenkins/scripts/release-tools/release.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/bf142fa7b7818afb5ae0fd65234e700616e9c0f2', 'message': 'make release script repo cloning function more resilient

The release scripts had been assuming that a valid gerrit user was
always configured already, but this is not necessarily the case on all
nodes. Now that the constraint update job has moved to the proposal
nodes, we need to make the cloner code try to configure the gerrit user
if "git review -s" fails. We can't always take that step because it
would result in using the wrong user on the signing node and when users
run the scripts by hand (as we still do frequently to recover from
failures).

Change-Id: Ife8108f0bff4be9ab63befc5eff4289be78316f7
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
make release script repo cloning function more resilient

The release scripts had been assuming that a valid gerrit user was
always configured already, but this is not necessarily the case on all
nodes. Now that the constraint update job has moved to the proposal
nodes, we need to make the cloner code try to configure the gerrit user
if "git review -s" fails. We can't always take that step because it
would result in using the wrong user on the signing node and when users
run the scripts by hand (as we still do frequently to recover from
failures).

Change-Id: Ife8108f0bff4be9ab63befc5eff4289be78316f7
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Use appropriate builders to set up Grenade job
instead of duplicating configuration.

commit_message:
Use DIB_GRUB_TIMEOUT to set boot timeout

We currently re-run all the grub setup in 99-fix-grub-timeout which
shouldn't really be necessary (actually a little problematic; although
this is dib's fault, see Ibaaa81124098f3c6febe48e455d3e1cd0a5f1761)

Use the new timeout flag to set this in the bootloader element
directly.

I think it is also an advantage that if you build a testing image with
./tools/build_image.sh this is configurable now ... having to fiddle
the bootloader for debugging is something that happens more than you'd
like.

This is supported since dib 1.26.0

Change-Id: Iafc660a9a8c072af6bf1fd5e51c419abccef4d54
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/71/412671/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: #!/bin/bash # Copyright (C) 2014 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or # implied. # # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. # This is done in 50 because the vm element has, at 51, an bunch of code # for properly handling grub. All we need to do here is get our values # in to the files. # dib-lint: disable=setu setpipefail if [ ${DIB_DEBUG_TRACE:-0} -gt 0 ]; then set -x fi set -e # Set grub timeout to zero to save boot time. if [ -f /etc/default/grub ] ; then sed -i -e 's/^GRUB_TIMEOUT=[0-9]\+/GRUB_TIMEOUT=0/' /etc/default/grub if which update-grub &> /dev/null ; then update-grub else if [[ $DISTRO_NAME == gentoo ]]; then GRUB_CFG=/boot/grub/grub.cfg else GRUB_CFG=/boot/grub2/grub.cfg fi # If update-grub isn't available, use grub2-mkconfig directly /usr/sbin/grub2-mkconfig -o "${GRUB_CFG}" fi elif [ -f /boot/grub/grub.conf ] ; then sed -i -e 's/^timeout=[0-9]\+/timeout=0/' /boot/grub/grub.conf fi

commit_message:
Remove some useless log messages

'Waiting for function _invoke_api to return' doesn't give any
information and only makes log files hard to read.

Also reduce logging when polling NFC leases.

Change-Id: I08653a0f529a186405695cbcfb9fc9018c93f856

commit_message:
Remove unused exception "InstanceNotFound"

In nova/virt/docker/driver.py, the "InstanceNotFound" import from
nova.exception. But the "InstanceNotFound" from zun.common.exception
is not used anywhere,so it should be removed.

Change-Id: Ie4d70adf763a6454183a500d427aa44743767501
Partial-Bug: #1651257

deleted_lines: class InstanceNotFound(ResourceNotFound): message = _("Instance %(instance)s could not be found.")

commit_message:
Add functional test for notifier backend

We have several notifier backends now. It is important to verify
that they are not broken when changes are made. Adding a test for
notifier backend verification. We can use this test to verify the
backends against each osprofiler patch.

Note: the support for messaging/ceilometer backend will be added
in a subsequent patch.

Change-Id: Icb0f453de30dbfa1a7a990e73391cf17a246e9bb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/osprofiler refs/changes/67/407967/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2016 VMware, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import os from oslo_config import cfg from osprofiler.drivers import base from osprofiler import initializer from osprofiler import opts from osprofiler import profiler from osprofiler.tests import test CONF = cfg.CONF class DriverTestCase(test.TestCase): SERVICE = "service" PROJECT = "project" def setUp(self): super(DriverTestCase, self).setUp() CONF(["--config-file", os.path.dirname(__file__) + "/config.cfg"]) opts.set_defaults(CONF, enabled=True, trace_sqlalchemy=False, hmac_keys="SECRET_KEY") @profiler.trace_cls("rpc", hide_args=True) class Foo(object): def bar(self, x): return self.baz(x, x) def baz(self, x, y): return x * y def _assert_dict(self, info, **kwargs): for key in kwargs: self.assertEqual(kwargs[key], info[key]) def _assert_child_dict(self, child, base_id, parent_id, name, fn_name): self.assertEqual(parent_id, child["parent_id"]) exp_info = {"name": "rpc", "service": self.SERVICE, "project": self.PROJECT} self._assert_dict(child["info"], **exp_info) exp_raw_info = {"project": self.PROJECT, "service": self.SERVICE} raw_start = child["info"]["meta.raw_payload.%s-start" % name] self._assert_dict(raw_start["info"], **exp_raw_info) self.assertEqual(fn_name, raw_start["info"]["function"]["name"]) exp_raw = {"name": "%s-start" % name, "service": self.SERVICE, "trace_id": child["trace_id"], "project": self.PROJECT, "base_id": base_id} self._assert_dict(raw_start, **exp_raw) raw_stop = child["info"]["meta.raw_payload.%s-stop" % name] self._assert_dict(raw_stop["info"], **exp_raw_info) exp_raw["name"] = "%s-stop" % name self._assert_dict(raw_stop, **exp_raw) def test_get_report(self): initializer.init_from_conf( CONF, None, self.PROJECT, self.SERVICE, "host") profiler.init("SECRET_KEY", project=self.PROJECT, service=self.SERVICE) foo = DriverTestCase.Foo() foo.bar(1) engine = base.get_driver(CONF.profiler.connection_string, project=self.PROJECT, service=self.SERVICE, host="host", conf=CONF) base_id = profiler.get().get_base_id() res = engine.get_report(base_id) self.assertEqual("total", res["info"]["name"]) self.assertEqual(2, res["stats"]["rpc"]["count"]) self.assertEqual(1, len(res["children"])) cbar = res["children"][0] self._assert_child_dict( cbar, base_id, base_id, "rpc", "osprofiler.tests.functional.test_driver.Foo.bar") self.assertEqual(1, len(cbar["children"])) cbaz = cbar["children"][0] self._assert_child_dict( cbaz, base_id, cbar["trace_id"], "rpc", "osprofiler.tests.functional.test_driver.Foo.baz")

commit_message:
Enabled debian / redhat image builds for diskimage-builder

Now that our nodepool-dsvm job supports multiple infra images, create
2 jobs to build redhat and debian images. The reason for 2, is we only
have 8GB of ram for devstack.

Change-Id: I474728a81b3ec0aa1dd54a529a3811aeeb2bb1a2
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add new project DCFabric

In order to promote the process of industrial application of the SDN technology as soon as possible,
under the auspices of the National High Technology Research and Development Program (863 Program)
"Key Technology Research and Demonstration of Software-Defined Networks (SDN)"
and the Shanghai Alliance of SDN Industrial Technology and Innovation Strategic.

Change-Id: I606a082209bed6b7db63f7de827878d8f49b89f4
Signed-off-by: jianqingjiang <18367826256@163.com>

added_lines: .. Warning: Do not edit this file. It is automatically generated from the software project's code and your changes will be overwritten. The tool to generate this file lives in openstack-doc-tools repository. Please make any changes needed in the code, then run the autogenerate-config-doc tool from the openstack-doc-tools repository, or ask for help on the documentation mailing list, IRC channel or meeting. .. _cinder-hitachi-hnas: .. list-table:: Description of Hitachi HNAS iSCSI and NFS driver configuration options :header-rows: 1 :class: config-ref-table * - Configuration option = Default value - Description * - **[DEFAULT]** - * - ``hds_hnas_iscsi_config_file`` = ``/opt/hds/hnas/cinder_iscsi_conf.xml`` - (String) DEPRECATED: Legacy configuration file for HNAS iSCSI Cinder plugin. This is not needed if you fill all configuration on cinder.conf * - ``hds_hnas_nfs_config_file`` = ``/opt/hds/hnas/cinder_nfs_conf.xml`` - (String) DEPRECATED: Legacy configuration file for HNAS NFS Cinder plugin. This is not needed if you fill all configuration on cinder.conf * - ``hnas_chap_enabled`` = ``True`` - (Boolean) Whether the chap authentication is enabled in the iSCSI target or not. * - ``hnas_cluster_admin_ip0`` = ``None`` - (String) The IP of the HNAS cluster admin. Required only for HNAS multi-cluster setups. * - ``hnas_mgmt_ip0`` = ``None`` - (IP) Management IP address of HNAS. This can be any IP in the admin address on HNAS or the SMU IP. * - ``hnas_password`` = ``None`` - (String) HNAS password. * - ``hnas_ssc_cmd`` = ``ssc`` - (String) Command to communicate to HNAS. * - ``hnas_ssh_port`` = ``22`` - (Port number) Port to be used for SSH authentication. * - ``hnas_ssh_private_key`` = ``None`` - (String) Path to the SSH private key used to authenticate in HNAS SMU. * - ``hnas_svc0_hdp`` = ``None`` - (String) Service 0 HDP * - ``hnas_svc0_iscsi_ip`` = ``None`` - (IP) Service 0 iSCSI IP * - ``hnas_svc0_volume_type`` = ``None`` - (String) Service 0 volume type * - ``hnas_svc1_hdp`` = ``None`` - (String) Service 1 HDP * - ``hnas_svc1_iscsi_ip`` = ``None`` - (IP) Service 1 iSCSI IP * - ``hnas_svc1_volume_type`` = ``None`` - (String) Service 1 volume type * - ``hnas_svc2_hdp`` = ``None`` - (String) Service 2 HDP * - ``hnas_svc2_iscsi_ip`` = ``None`` - (IP) Service 2 iSCSI IP * - ``hnas_svc2_volume_type`` = ``None`` - (String) Service 2 volume type * - ``hnas_svc3_hdp`` = ``None`` - (String) Service 3 HDP * - ``hnas_svc3_iscsi_ip`` = ``None`` - (IP) Service 3 iSCSI IP * - ``hnas_svc3_volume_type`` = ``None`` - (String) Service 3 volume type * - ``hnas_username`` = ``None`` - (String) HNAS username.

commit_message:
WIP DO NOT MERGE Tentative cib_push implementation

POC code to implement a cib_push method that will allow
to atomically update the CIB with multiple changes.

Change-Id: I6b4ae8d4fefecdd8f35b2f5daf529ab4b5b41d72
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-pacemaker refs/changes/19/402219/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'fileutils' require 'tmpdir' Puppet::Type.type(:pcmk_cib_push).provide(:default) do desc 'A resource definition for a cib push method' ### overloaded methods def create operations = @resource[:operations] cib = backup_cib() Puppet.debug("create: CIB was backed up to #{cib}") operations.each do |ops| pcs_cmd = ops[0] unless_cmd = ops[1] cmd = "/usr/sbin/pcs -f #{cib} #{pcs_cmd}" output = `#{cmd}` ret = $? # The unless command succeeded so we bail out and let exists return # false because we need to recreate the resource fully Puppet.debug("create: cmd #{cmd} returned #{ret.exitstatus} -> #{output}") if !ret.success? msg = "create: Running: #{cmd} failed with code: #{ret.exitstatus} -> #{output}. Not pushing the CIB." FileUtils.rm(cib, :force => true) raise Puppet::Error, msg end end push_cib(cib) FileUtils.rm(cib, :force => true) return true end def exists? operations = @resource[:operations] cib = backup_cib() Puppet.debug("exists: CIB was backed up to #{cib}") # We run all our unless commands against the offline CIB # and if they all return true it means the CIB already # has all the resources so we can safely return true from # this function so that we do not push a CIB unnecessarily do_all_resources_exist = true operations.each do |ops| pcs_cmd = ops[0] unless_cmd = ops[1] cmd = "/usr/sbin/pcs -f #{cib} #{unless_cmd}" output = `#{cmd}` ret = $? # The unless command succeeded so we bail out and let exists return # false because we need to recreate the resource fully Puppet.debug("exists: cmd #{cmd} returned #{ret.exitstatus} -> #{output}") if !ret.success? do_all_resources_exist = false break end end FileUtils.rm(cib, :force => true) Puppet.debug("exists: do_all_resources_exist #{do_all_resources_exist}") return do_all_resources_exist end # backs up the current cib and returns the temporary file name where it # was stored def backup_cib() name = @resource[:name] # We use the pacemaker CIB folder because of its restricted access permissions cib = Dir::Tmpname.make_tmpname "/var/lib/pacemaker/cib/cib-puppet-backup-#{name}-", nil cmd = "/usr/sbin/pcs cluster cib #{cib}" output = `#{cmd}` ret = $? if not ret.success? msg = "backup_cib: Running: #{cmd} failed with code: #{ret.exitstatus} -> #{output}" FileUtils.rm(cib, :force => true) raise Puppet::Error, msg end Puppet.debug("backup_cib: #{cmd} returned #{output}") return cib end # Pushes the cib file back to the cluster and removes the cib file def push_cib(cib) name = @resource[:name] cmd = "/usr/sbin/pcs cluster cib-push #{cib} --config" output = `#{cmd}` ret = $? FileUtils.rm(cib, :force => true) if not ret.success? msg = "push_cib: Running: #{cmd} failed with code: #{ret.exitstatus} -> #{output}" raise Puppet::Error, msg end Puppet.debug("push_cib: #{cmd} returned #{output}") return true end end

subject: WIP DO NOT MERGE Allow the creation of resources in disabled state
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-06 18:53:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-pacemaker/commit/ca4163c92efb8d7588d5348e0cbb4af6797f5bf9', 'message': 'WIP DO NOT MERGE Allow the creation of resources in disabled state

Add a "disabled_on_create" parameter which does the following:
1) disabled_on_create == false [default]
1.1) If the resource does not exist it gets created
1.2) If the resource exists but is disabled it gets enabled
1.3) If the resource exists and is enabled it is left alone

2) disabled_on_create == true
2.1) If the resource does not exist, it gets created with the
     --disabled switch in pcs
2.2) If the resource does exist it is left alone. I.e. it does
     not get disabled if the resource exists and is enabled

This approach allows us to do the following:
pacemaker::resource::ocf { 'delay-stopped' :
  pcs_name           => 'delay',
  ocf_agent_name     => 'heartbeat:Delay',
  disabled_on_create => true,
} ->
...create constraints based on delay stopped...
-> pacemaker::resource::ocf { 'delay-started' :
  pcs_name        => 'delay',
  ocf_agent_name  => 'heartbeat:Delay',
}

The introduction of the optional 'pcs_name' parameter is a way
to be able to declare the same resource twice in two different
states (disabled and enabled) but still pointing to the same
pcs resource.

WIP because I still need to run more test in the composable
HA work

Change-Id: I6c39499d14e3e48c638808a5a900fce3fef9eb0b
Closes-Bug: #1627746
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-07 19:13:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-pacemaker/commit/41daa64949748493d6710318188a0f1db1efd544', 'message': 'WIP DO NOT MERGE Allow the creation of resources in disabled state

commit_message:
WIP DO NOT MERGE Allow the creation of resources in disabled state

Add a "disabled_on_create" parameter which does the following:
1) disabled_on_create == false [default]
1.1) If the resource does not exist it gets created
1.2) If the resource exists but is disabled it gets enabled
1.3) If the resource exists and is enabled it is left alone

2) disabled_on_create == true
2.1) If the resource does not exist, it gets created with the
     --disabled switch in pcs
2.2) If the resource does exist it is left alone. I.e. it does
     not get disabled if the resource exists and is enabled

This approach allows us to do the following:
pacemaker::resource::ocf { 'delay-stopped' :
  pcs_name           => 'delay',
  ocf_agent_name     => 'heartbeat:Delay',
  disabled_on_create => true,
} ->
...create constraints based on delay stopped...
-> pacemaker::resource::ocf { 'delay-started' :
  pcs_name        => 'delay',
  ocf_agent_name  => 'heartbeat:Delay',
}

The introduction of the optional 'pcs_name' parameter is a way
to be able to declare the same resource twice in two different
states (disabled and enabled) but still pointing to the same
pcs resource.

WIP because I still need to run more test in the composable
HA work

Change-Id: I6c39499d14e3e48c638808a5a900fce3fef9eb0b
Closes-Bug: #1627746

added_lines: $disabled_on_create = false, disabled_on_create => $disabled_on_create,

commit_message:
Use default user group consistently

Default user group should be set much earlier in deployment
and should be used consistently accross all projects.

Change-Id: Id399f9ddebc903bb9c3eeb5a0ff6f33ca6d6828c
Closes-Bug: #1650501

commit_message:
Adapt coding-checks.sh to this project

So that pylint acutually does something meaningful.

Also, fix a few issues found by pylint.
(These seems like evil hacks to bypass parent class' method.
But I'm not entirely sure why they were necessary.)

Closes-Bug: #1649452
Change-Id: Ib59f270fbfd42a6cf7101875c57d4544c13c000d

commit_message:
Fix image handling when shared storage is being used

The image cache operation uses thread locks, for which reason it is
prone to race conditions when using shared storage. This is avoided
by using file locks, placed on the shared path.

Change-Id: I2b002993b7ab0973960794bfdd81d4fe57bf7399
Partial-Bug: #1565895
(cherry picked from commit 7c2e267d5da59cce6eb19e1ec6e98679ec0af102)

commit_message:
Avoid Forcing the Translation of Translatable Variables

Whenever possible translation should not be forced by use of six.text_type()
on a message being used with a format string.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#avoid-forcing-the-translation-of-translatable-variables

Change-Id: Iabde2f7d6a98115c0bf7d3ef097bafb0a13d6cbe

commit_message:
Minor Fixes

3 minor fixes discovered while debugging the python long running
storlet.

1.  Upon timeout middleware sends a cancel command that
    is processed by manager.py who kills the process.
    the os.kill call was missing the signal to send

2. The ansible script that is used to re-deploy the container
   locally once a container side code is updated had a typo

3. The storlet_timeout was written to the swift conf files
   instead of the gatewat conf file and so was effectively
   non configurable

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I36e0afb3e21ba2ca59add16fe86bfafcdad26a11

commit_message:
Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove ec2-api.

Change-Id: I820a62970a8f870804a580b8dded0624c50b8b0a

commit_message:
Add missing LOG mocks to unittests

While running the tox tests recently it became apparent
that missing LOG mocks have crept into the unit tests again.

Although there is no pep8 check for this (wish there were!)
it is a much cleaner run when all the log messages are
suppressed.

Change-Id: I0e486111267c442625eb021df9531324e4cdd9fb

subject: Use lower value to create flavor for creating server
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-20 07:36:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/2289798d505f901105cfb09be669bf36c46c84e2', 'message': 'Use flavor created based on self.flavor_ref to create server

Running test_resize_server_using_overlimit_vcpus will sometimes
fail with "No valid host was found", because it uses fixed values
as disk/ram/vcpus, and this is not safe if the environment doesn't
meet the resource requirement.
The more safe way is to create flavor based on self.flavor_ref,
for self.flavor_ref is generally usable for the environment.

Change-Id: I6201333f8d288a4f704971643607e19173165b36
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-21 01:38:10.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/admin/test_servers_negative.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/854acc025396e51537ca60e55e498a6766dc69aa', 'message': 'Use lower value to create flavor for creating server

Running test_resize_server_using_overlimit_vcpus will sometimes
fail with "No valid host was found", because the values it uses
for disk/ram/vcpus are a little too large(especially vcpus value),
the environment may don't meet the resource requirement.
This is to use lower value to create flavor to avoid "No valid host
was found" exception.

Change-Id: I6201333f8d288a4f704971643607e19173165b36
'}]
commit_message:
Use lower value to create flavor for creating server

Running test_resize_server_using_overlimit_vcpus will sometimes
fail with "No valid host was found", because the values it uses
for disk/ram/vcpus are a little too large(especially vcpus value),
the environment may don't meet the resource requirement.
This is to use lower value to create flavor to avoid "No valid host
was found" exception.

Change-Id: I6201333f8d288a4f704971643607e19173165b36

Adds release note for 'Route extend_volume' bugfix

This adds a missing release note for the bugfix 'Route extend_volume calls to
scheduler' - I4a4ee8acac258d773b99e2767f1c75faa909813b - that weren't added in
the patch.

commit_message:
Add check for virthost being defined but empty

I'm still not completely clear how this happened, but this
morning I helped someone debug a case where they called
quickstart and managed to get "-e virthost= -t tag1,tag2"
then the (predictable) SSH error when we could not connect
to hostname: ""

This commit checks for this specific case.

Change-Id: Ie30a65b070cf91670012a79ffb13859c8626631d

commit_message:
Enable cold migration with target host(1/3)

This function enables users to specify a target host
when cold migrating a VM instance.

This patch modifies 'prep_resize' compute RPC.
Subsequent patches modify a compute API, conductor
and the migration API.

Change-Id: Ifcdee48ab988ff2c7c5abad6b7d3eaf32a89f172
Implements: blueprint cold-migration-with-target-ocata

commit_message:
[Core] Remove map_for_scenario

Context.map_for_scenario blocks adding of subtask context
because map_for_scenario requires "users" context to be present
in workload context in order to choose user for each iteration.

This patch moves logic for choosing user into OpenStackScenario
class and removes everything related to map_for_scenario.

Change-Id: I322a6f62d432c5da2120496c474c7c3977d43290

for Angularized panel in Horizon.

commit_message:
Correct the order of assertEqual

The params order of assertEqual is (expected, observed),
some tests in test_server.py are in wrong order.

Change-Id: I95054cac6d9c34dd978fdae2a38823273d8b867d

commit_message:
Default implementation parse_live_resource_data

Add default implementation for parse_live_resource_data
to reduce number of override methods in resource plugins.

Also, add separate method for resolving update_allowed
properties.

implements bp get-reality-for-resources

Change-Id: Ie7ee043d06fbf3bc910fa40dc7f8f17c2fbb4303

commit_message:
Add 'parent' property for keystone project

Keystone v3 supports the tenant hierarchy, so add
'parent' property for project resource in heat to
allow user specify the parent when creating a project
with heat template.

Change-Id: Ia7a2d68be5fe333809eefcbf74d6b56272b2af03
Closes-Bug: #1505117

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-13 08:49:30.000000000', 'files': ['aodh/storage/sqlalchemy/alembic/versions/367aadf5485f_precisetimestamp_to_datetime.py', 'releasenotes/notes/drop-mysql-precise-datetime-e374c77e6707985e.yaml', 'releasenotes/notes/mysql-precise-datetime-e374c77e6707985e.yaml', 'aodh/storage/sqlalchemy/models.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/aodh/commit/a470b6d451cb5bb2c0c24e7c196571cbeab75da0', 'message': "Use DateTime instead of precise timestamp

Currently, we have supported precise timestamp in Aodh, which type was
manullly implemented in Aodh and then was replaced by new DATETIME
format in MySQL>=5.6.4. After that change, aodh strongly depends on the
version of MySQL=5.6.4, that may easily hurt operator when deploying Aodh,
since all the others components don't have this requirement. I'd prefer we
use the built-in DateTime type in sqlalchemy, there is no strong reason
that we need precise timestamp in Aodh.

Change-Id: Ib3b9c05e0a77288eac103980b834e03dc2cd1187
Closes-Bug: #1649484

commit_message:
Use DateTime instead of precise timestamp

Currently, we have supported precise timestamp in Aodh, which type was
manullly implemented in Aodh and then was replaced by new DATETIME
format in MySQL>=5.6.4. After that change, aodh strongly depends on the
version of MySQL=5.6.4, that may easily hurt operator when deploying Aodh,
since all the others components don't have this requirement. I'd prefer we
use the built-in DateTime type in sqlalchemy, there is no strong reason
that we need precise timestamp in Aodh.

Change-Id: Ib3b9c05e0a77288eac103980b834e03dc2cd1187
Closes-Bug: #1649484
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/aodh refs/changes/02/410102/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: timestamp = Column(DateTime, default=timeutils.utcnow) state_timestamp = Column(DateTime, default=timeutils.utcnow) timestamp = Column(DateTime, default=timeutils.utcnow)
deleted_lines: from sqlalchemy.dialects import mysqlclass TimestampUTC(TypeDecorator): """Represents a timestamp precise to the microsecond.""" impl = DateTime def load_dialect_impl(self, dialect): if dialect.name == 'mysql': return dialect.type_descriptor(mysql.DATETIME(fsp=6)) return self.impl timestamp = Column(TimestampUTC, default=lambda: timeutils.utcnow()) state_timestamp = Column(TimestampUTC, default=lambda: timeutils.utcnow()) timestamp = Column(TimestampUTC, default=lambda: timeutils.utcnow())

commit_message:
Remove the TODO for subscription ttl test

The subscription TTL test has ran at server side with tempest test
already. And it's a slow test because the minimum of TTL is 60
seconds, so we don't need add this to client functional test now.

Change-Id: I8734703e52594f63079b24acb338af3af6c406e8

commit_message:
Dont run with VIRTUAL_ENV set

debian ships a modified site.py which has some interesting behavior when
VIRTUAL_ENV is set. In this case it will add
/usr/lib/pythonx.x/site-packages to the start of sys.path. This causes
pip to install packages to this location (rather than /usr/local). As a
result, later on when booting where VIRTUAL_ENV is not set this branch
is not hit and the path where python packages were installed is not part
of sys.path.

Change-Id: Icdb769541eee9793f261b4b8ec563be76ee13fe2

commit_message:
Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove python-zaqarclient.

Change-Id: I43da802224be8e3ff249a8fa1d5bd4d6475ba391
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-zaqarclient refs/changes/51/413351/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: minversion = 2.0install_command = {toxinidir}/tools/tox_install.sh {env:UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE:https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/plain/upper-constraints.txt} {opts} {packages} BRANCH_NAME=master CLIENT_NAME=python-zaqarclient

commit_message:
Add 'unmanaging' state to volumes and snapshots

'unmanaging' is different from 'deleting', and must
be distinguishable to know how to recover from a failed
delete/unmanage operation.  The current state of things
makes it so that an 'unmanaging' volume may end up being
accidentally deleted.

Add unmanage notifications, as well.

Partial-Bug: #1478959

Change-Id: I06f60a584f219043673095346282c429773704f8

', u'created': u'2016-11-23T07:57:04Z'} | | flavor | m1.tiny (1) | | hostId | | | id | 6ec42311-a121-4887-aece-48fb93a4a098 | | image | cirros (9fef3b2d-c35d-4b61-bea8-09cc6dc41829) | | key_name | None | | name | test-instance | | os-extended-volumes:volumes_attached | [] | | project_id | 5669caad86a04256994cdf755df4d3c1 | | properties | | | status | ERROR | | updated | 2016-11-23T07:57:04Z | | user_id | c36cec73b0e44876a4478b1e6cd749bb | +--------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+If :command:`openstack server show` does not sufficiently explain the failure, searching for the instance UUID in the ``nova-compute.log`` on the compute node it was scheduled on or the ``nova-scheduler.log`` on your scheduler hostsUsing :command:`openstack server show` as an admin user will show the compute node the instance was scheduled on as ``hostId``. commit_message:
Fix checkpoint fullstack

As the sake of the merge of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/348163/,
the plugin for volume can't work, so we have to skip the related fullstack
before https://review.openstack.org/#/c/413563/ merge.

Change-Id: I9c7f51af51697e55846905c8fa435e6323e701e4

commit_message:
Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to clients is slightly more complex than
services as the clients themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove oslo.reports.

Change-Id: I7124fd1b8fbb58b80c2ee9ae9d323afc0137e230

commit_message:
[doc] point release note docs to project team guide

no point in maintaining our own doc, the project team guide
(not to be confused with the other PTG) already documents
when and how to create release notes.

Change-Id: I894b335fbb1d4b16d1813c11c9dc912dcbf55bba
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/42/413142/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The Keystone team uses `reno <http://docs.openstack.org/developer/reno/usage.html>`_ to generate release notes. These are important user-facing documents that must be included when a user-facing change is performed. A release note should be included in the same patch the work is being performed. For more information on how and when to create release notes, see the `project-team-guide <http://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/release-management.html#managing-release-notes>`_.
deleted_lines: The release notes for a patch should be included in the patch. If not, the release notes should be in a follow-on review. If the following applies to the patch, a release note is required: * The deployer needs to take an action when upgrading * The backend driver interface changes * A new feature is implemented * Function was removed (hopefully it was deprecated) * Current behavior is changed * A new config option is added that the deployer should consider changing from the default * A security bug is fixed A release note is suggested if a long-standing or important bug is fixed. Otherwise, a release note is not required. Keystone uses `reno <http://docs.openstack.org/developer/reno/usage.html>`_ to generate release notes. Please read the docs for details. In summary, use .. code-block:: bash $ tox -e venv -- reno new <bug-,bp-,whatever> Then edit the sample file that was created and push it with your change. To see the results: .. code-block:: bash $ git commit # Commit the change because reno scans git log. $ tox -e releasenotes Then look at the generated release notes files in ``releasenotes/build/html`` in your favorite browser.

commit_message:
Fix service_get mock method

Current service_get mock method in
cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib/test_volume_manage.py does not match the
signature of the method that it's mocking from
cinder/db/sqlalchemy/api.py.

This patch updates the method's signature to match the method as defined
in the DB implementation.

Change-Id: I0e20d27865d4ca4556123979e656ed954206052e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/03/412403/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: def service_get(context, id, host=None, binary=None, *args, **kwargs): """Replacement for Service.service_get_by_host_and_topic. We mock the Service.service_get_by_host_and_topic method to return something for a specific host, and raise an exception for anything else.

commit_message:
Add ovb-updates job to cistatus page

This is now running in non-voting form on all patches to verify its
stability.  Adding it to the status page will make it easier to
keep track of how often it's passing or failing.

Change-Id: Ic3eeeafe567bd3ae2e0c5abb9129b472dbb9bc2d

commit_message:
Define v3 domains_client as library

Migrate identity v3 API domains_client to tempest.lib and implement
unit test for the service clients.
Init files are edited and the old ones in tempest/services/identity are removed
as this is the last identity client to migrate.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Co-Authored-By: ghanshyam <ghanshyammann@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ia3f5693156d6d9dff4f8b0b1986c5bc456af804a

commit_message:
Correcting Floating IPs

This patch changes some parameters in floatingip
from 'in:body' to 'in:path'.

Change-Id: Ic30a39c71e3eeeee0bf2be3333e5c8da4b39c70b
Closes-Bug: #1614817
Partially-Implements: blueprint neutron-in-tree-api-ref
Co-Authored-by: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove oslo.serialization.

Change-Id: If02798738dd0293ede4e3d6939e6d5cf6b0182ec

commit_message:
networking-odl: new experimental gate job for new netvirt

Added a new experimental gate non-voting job to test on new netvirt of
OpenDaylight.

The reason why we use a new job template to do this is that it will make
it much more easy for us to switch the whole CI to new netvirt without
changing many of the CI job names.

Change-Id: I81c8a97ebfdbe38fcfd86a9d8dd7e7ce9c3e224b
Partial-Bug: #1643948
Partial-Bug: #1646940

subject: Call load_environment before mocking it
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-15 21:55:45.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_inventory.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/71d97eb7a875139f21be9503ae4666e0a95fc1e5', 'message': "Call load_environment before mocking it

The load_environment call happened after mocking, resulting in a mock
object being used for the duplicated IP test. Inspecting
inventory.keys() during this test shows a length of 29, with only the
groups defined in the config file being present.

Moving the call outside the mocked context and providing data instead
moves the number of keys up to 240, which includes the entries from the
environment.

While this change isn't necessarily material to the check for duplicated
IPs, it is closer to the intent of exercising the generation system
fully.

Change-Id: I1e17e3ca4227f1da3fc7aa8accda4e93fa90d245
"}]
commit_message:
Call load_environment before mocking it

The load_environment call happened after mocking, resulting in a mock
object being used for the duplicated IP test. Inspecting
inventory.keys() during this test shows a length of 29, with only the
groups defined in the config file being present.

Moving the call outside the mocked context and providing data instead
moves the number of keys up to 240, which includes the entries from the
environment.

While this change isn't necessarily material to the check for duplicated
IPs, it is closer to the intent of exercising the generation system
fully.

Change-Id: I1e17e3ca4227f1da3fc7aa8accda4e93fa90d245
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/13/411513/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.env = fs.load_environment(BASE_ENV_DIR, {}) mock_load_env.return_value = self.env

commit_message:
Add libvirt image metadef for hw_pointer_model

Nova has supported this image property for awhile so let's
document it in the glance metadef registry.

DocImpact: Need to update 'Image service property keys' doc
in the CLI reference:

  http://docs.openstack.org/cli-reference/glance-property-keys.html

Change-Id: I7c77fb13f20b59ad764070d14dc98a46f8b7c823

commit_message:
Forbid removing portgroup mode

Mode can be left empty on creation, the value will be populated by
the dbapi, but in case of updates, we should not allow removing it.

Partial-Bug: #1618754
Change-Id: I917b23bc155972b777b143d16545a49039604910
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/00/413000/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [{'path': '/mode', 'op': 'add', 'value': '802.3ad'}], mock_upd) def test_remove_mode_not_allowed(self, mock_upd): response = self.patch_json('/portgroups/%s' % self.portgroup.uuid, [{'path': '/mode', 'op': 'remove'}], expect_errors=True, headers=self.headers) self.assertEqual(http_client.BAD_REQUEST, response.status_int) self.assertEqual('application/json', response.content_type) self.assertTrue(response.json['error_message']) self.assertFalse(mock_upd.called)

commit_message:
Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove stevedore.

Change-Id: I7a1285a2c3882b02987bfa95950689f5282aa407

subject: Mark sibling CPUs as 'used' for cpu_thread_policy = 'isolated'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-28 10:35:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/539d6663d203aff146bbd590998b37e219c3aa5b', 'message': 'This patch fixes two problems:

1. 'require' CPU allocation thread policy is guarantee
that no vCPUs from other guests wouldn't be able to be
placed on the cores of booted VM (In this case core is
a set of sibling vCPUs).

But we still able to boot VMs with 'dedicated' CPU
allocation policy on these cores.

To fix it we should mark each CPU in sibling group as
'used' if even one of them is really used by VM with
'require' policy.

2. Described problem is fixed for 'isolate' CPU allocation
thread policy if host has HyperThreading. But this problem
is still actual for hosts without hyperThreading. In this
case sets of siblings vCPUs are empty for each core but we
are still trying to work with them as with HyperThreading cores.
This causes the problem when one "isolated" core is used by
several VMs.

To fix it we must stop handle cores with 'isolate' policy
and without HyperThreading like cores with siblings. In
this case CPU isolation will be guaranteed by 'dedicated'
CPU allocation policy. Remember that 'isolate' CPU thread
allocation policy can be used only combined with 'dedicated'
CPU allocation policy'.

Change-Id: I8f72187153c930cd941b7ee7e835a20ed0c0de03
Closes-Bug: #1637454
Closes-Bug: #1635674
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-28 10:56:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/0be983626bf8e3aad4012a7ff08d148833e7368e', 'message': 'This patch fixes two problems:

1. 'require' CPU allocation thread policy is guarantee
that no vCPUs from other guests wouldn't be able to be

But we still able to boot VMs with 'dedicated' CPU
allocation policy on these cores.

To fix it we should mark each CPU in sibling group as

2. Described problem is fixed for 'isolate' CPU allocation
thread policy if host has HyperThreading. But this problem
is still actual for hosts without hyperThreading. In this
case sets of siblings vCPUs are empty for each core but we
are still trying to work with them as with HyperThreading cores.
This causes the problem when one "isolated" core is used by

To fix it we must stop handle cores with 'isolate' policy
and without HyperThreading like cores with siblings. In
this case CPU isolation will be guaranteed by 'dedicated'
CPU allocation policy. Remember that 'isolate' CPU thread
allocation policy can be used only combined with 'dedicated'
CPU allocation policy'.

Closes-Bug: #1637454
Closes-Bug: #1635674

Change-Id: I8f72187153c930cd941b7ee7e835a20ed0c0de03
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-10-28 11:10:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/6fff42fd8c5723bb5fc4117e40740a24711e9067', 'message': 'Mark sibling CPUs as 'used' for cpu_thread_policy = 'isolated' or 'require'

This patch fixes two problems:

1. 'require' CPU allocation thread policy is guarantee
that no vCPUs from other guests wouldn't be able to be
placed on the cores of booted VM (In this case core is
a set of sibling vCPUs).

But we still able to boot VMs with 'dedicated' CPU
allocation policy on these cores.

To fix it we should mark each CPU in sibling group as
'used' if even one of them is really used by VM with
'require' policy.

2. Described problem is fixed for 'isolate' CPU allocation
thread policy if host has HyperThreading. But this problem
is still actual for hosts without hyperThreading. In this
case sets of siblings vCPUs are empty for each core but we
are still trying to work with them as with HyperThreading
cores. This causes the problem when one "isolated" core
is used by several VMs.

To fix it we must stop handle cores with 'isolate' policy
and without HyperThreading like cores with siblings. In
this case CPU isolation will be guaranteed by 'dedicated'
CPU allocation policy. Remember that 'isolate' CPU thread
allocation policy can be used only combined with 'dedicated'
CPU allocation policy'.

Closes-Bug: #1637454
Closes-Bug: #1635674

Change-Id: I8f72187153c930cd941b7ee7e835a20ed0c0de03
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-09 12:38:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/57ae3fbbe6d184269b9699e8b30e9de99bc31c69', 'message': 'Mark sibling CPUs as 'used' for cpu_thread_policy = 'isolated'

'isolated' CPU allocation thread policy is guarantee
that no vCPUs from other guests wouldn't be able to be
placed on the cores of booted VM (In this case core is
a set of sibling vCPUs).

But we still able to boot VMs with 'dedicated' CPU
allocation policy on these cores. This problem is actual
for hosts without HyperThreading. In this case sets of
siblings vCPUs are empty for each core but we are still
trying to work with them as with HyperThreading cores.
This causes the problem when one "isolated" core
is used by several VMs.

To fix it we must use method unpin_cpus_with_siblings()
only if NUMA cell has siblings (i.e. has HyperThreading).
For cells without HyperThreading CPU isolation is
guaranteed by 'dedicated' CPU allocation policy.

Closes-Bug: #1635674

Change-Id: I8f72187153c930cd941b7ee7e835a20ed0c0de03
'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2016-12-08 14:23:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/ac33e32b83aa6bbc37cd60935a8d9f49337dc0a3', 'message': 'Mark sibling CPUs as 'used' for cpu_thread_policy = 'isolated'

'isolated' CPU allocation thread policy is guarantee
that no vCPUs from other guests wouldn't be able to be
placed on the cores of booted VM (In this case core is
a set of sibling vCPUs).

But we still able to boot VMs with 'dedicated' CPU
allocation policy on these cores. This problem is actual
for hosts without HyperThreading. In this case sets of
siblings vCPUs are empty for each core but we are still
trying to work with them as with HyperThreading cores.
This causes the problem when one "isolated" core
is used by several VMs.

To fix it we must use method unpin_cpus_with_siblings()
only if NUMA cell has siblings (i.e. has HyperThreading).
For cells without HyperThreading CPU isolation is

commit_message:
Mark sibling CPUs as 'used' for cpu_thread_policy = 'isolated'

'isolated' CPU allocation thread policy is guarantee
that no vCPUs from other guests wouldn't be able to be
placed on the cores of booted VM (In this case core is
a set of sibling vCPUs).

But we still able to boot VMs with 'dedicated' CPU
allocation policy on these cores. This problem is actual
for hosts without HyperThreading. In this case sets of
siblings vCPUs are empty for each core but we are still
trying to work with them as with HyperThreading cores.
This causes the problem when one "isolated" core
is used by several VMs.

To fix it we must use method unpin_cpus_with_siblings()
only if NUMA cell has siblings (i.e. has HyperThreading).
For cells without HyperThreading CPU isolation is
guaranteed by 'dedicated' CPU allocation policy.

Closes-Bug: #1635674

Change-Id: I8f72187153c930cd941b7ee7e835a20ed0c0de03
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/16/391416/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(snikitin): 'require' or 'isolate' CPU allocation # thread policy makes us to mark each CPU in sibling group # as 'used' if even one of them is really used by VM. # We have to do it to guarantee that no other VM with any # CPU policy/CPU thread policy wouldn't use these sibling # CPUs. # # But we wouldn't do it if CPU thread policy is 'isolate' # and there is no siblings in NUMA cell. It means that # current cell doesn't use HyperThreading. In this case # CPU isolation is guaranteed by 'dedicated' CPU allocation # policy. Remember that 'isolate' CPU thread allocation # policy can be used only combined with 'dedicated' CPU # allocation policy'. is_sibling_pinning = ( instancecell.cpu_thread_policy == fields.CPUThreadAllocationPolicy.REQUIRE or ( instancecell.cpu_thread_policy == hostcell.siblings)) if is_sibling_pinning: if is_sibling_pinning: if is_sibling_pinning:

commit_message:
Fix Resource.__eq__ mismatch semantics of object equal

The __eq__ of apiclient.base.Resource will return True,
if the two objects have same id, even if they have different
other attributes value. The behavior is weird and don't
match the semantics of object equal. The objects that have
different value should be different objects.
Fix this issue and add some test cases in this patch.

Change-Id: I5a5e747f1f963d01b7b0b17dad791a99c9947aef
Closes-Bug: #1499369

commit_message:
fill series when aggregating cross metrics

this fills in series so that overlap of all series is not required
to aggregate. we only fill in if at least one of the metrics contains
a point in the timeslot.

Closes-Bug: #1642661
Change-Id: I1a29f0095387c326bdc87af760a3ccb4a95de828

commit_message:
Add script to encrypt some sensitive informations

Now some sensitive informations like password or token
are configured as plaintext. it may be no so safelly. so
we should make it storage with ciphertext.

Change-Id: I097593842df0942429f5a7b6d367169fcb835d9e

commit_message:
leave the unreleased branch unspecified for release notes

Do not specify a branch for unreleased.rst so it tests notes under
review rather than notes already merged.

Change-Id: If3e4982bcc457906eeebb99de660f6c594b122f0
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove oslo.context.

Change-Id: I6c9bead1bbafd13e6639574955081edca93211f6

commit_message:
Revert "acceptance: run aodh services after rabbitmq resources"

We cleaned up unused code in commit:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/399969/
and accidently added it in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/413237/.
That fix for resource ordering was useful for puppet 3, but
as now we are running tests against puppet 4, this code becomes useless.

This reverts commit 4cf2b7f2f882e5146bd86183fd156438d6409328.

Change-Id: I892cbc3b6957f54dae12bd133911df38937e367a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-aodh refs/changes/37/413537/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove oslo.log.

Change-Id: Ib6001210350743827eae4f5306464e68e057d4c6

commit_message:
Remove redundant migration status update

Migration status is updated to 'error' by _rollback_live_migration in
case of exception. So there is no need to update migration status
just before calling _rollback_live_migration.

Removed redundant status update as mentioned in the review:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/215483/3

Related-Bug: 1470420
Change-Id: I995851b770d5b551a4768ced7f069d426a7dac28

commit_message:
Use os.path.join instead of string concatenation

In pci/utils method 'is_physical_function' concatenates
the sriov total vfs path, it's preferred to use os.path.join instead.

Change-Id: Ia4e97f111e6786637be08cabb2a8939cb631f597

subject: libvirt: Cannot live-migrate VM using default cpu model
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-23 17:39:18.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/cbf08cd58915015fef9c95ffea0a46bc0aa64b25', 'message': "libvirt: Cannot live-migrate VM using default cpu model

When we spawn instance without CPU model configured (CONF.libvirt.cpu_mode = none),
then the instance boots up with 'qemu' CPU model which should be widely compatible.

However, when none is specified, nova/virt/libvirt/driver::_compare_cpu() check
will use the host CPU features, so if we launch on Haswell CPU, it fails to
migrate to a SandyBridge which has lesser features.

Since qemu CPU models are generally compatible, and the claims test selects
adequate cpu topology, we do not need to do the _compare_cpu check when the
guest instance CPU model is None. This fix removes that specific check.

Change-Id: Iaad563fe743314263cd71a51f29911a36f1885c1


"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Cannot live-migrate VM using default cpu model

When we spawn instance without CPU model configured (CONF.libvirt.cpu_mode = none),
then the instance boots up with 'qemu' CPU model which should be widely compatible.

However, when none is specified, nova/virt/libvirt/driver::_compare_cpu() check
will use the host CPU features, so if we launch on Haswell CPU, it fails to
migrate to a SandyBridge which has lesser features.

Since qemu CPU models are generally compatible, and the claims test selects
adequate cpu topology, we do not need to do the _compare_cpu check when the
guest instance CPU model is None. This fix removes that specific check.

Change-Id: Iaad563fe743314263cd71a51f29911a36f1885c1

commit_message:
Avoid opening parents when fetching VHD info

This change ensures that when a VHD is queried, the parent images
are not opened by default.

'get_vhd_info' now accepts the 'open_parents' argument, which can be
useful for validating a VHD chain.

Closes-Bug: #1648555

Change-Id: Ie6b4febb4357419e6bb6395b4abb0ab10006a4f0
(cherry picked from commit 6259f2c4190b0953ec181ef06c302f4b6d75e11b)

commit_message:
Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to libraries is slightly more complex than
services as the libraries themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove oslo.db.

Change-Id: I31febfe00698e36f4c2e0e41c3f7bf64acf47adf
